subSubSection.paragraph: The species name, a noun in apposition, refers to the foot-like style apex.

subSubSection.paragraph:
7 Apr. 2002
; MA-02-09C-23; INHS
•
1 ♂ , 1 ♀ ; Parc National Ranomafana , Belle Vue at Talatakely ; 21°15.99′ S , 47°25.21′ E ; alt.
1020 m
;
28 Apr.–5 May 2002
; MA-02-09C-27; CAS
.

Length of male 7.2–9.3 mm , female 8.9 mm . Dorsum uniformly pale stramineous, except marginal rim of crown black. Crown distinctly shorter than pronotum, anterior margin broadly rounded. Hind tibial rows PD, AD and AV with 17–18, 12 and 12–13 macrosetae, respectively. Style apophysis in lateral view broad and ventrally denticulate through most of length, abruptly constricted prepically, with footlike apical extension bearing apically recurved dorsal toe and acutely angulate ventral heel. Connective with anterior margin slightly convex. Aedeagus with atrium in posterior view narrowly quadrate, shaft simple, very slender and tubular; basal process broader than but nearly of same length as shaft, closely parallel to shaft through most of length. Female abdominal sternite VII with posterior margin trilobed, lateral lobes narrower than medial lobe. Second valvulae relatively slender, only slightly broadened toward midlength, distal fourth of dorsal margin coarsely serrate, with teeth offset between sides.
